intro: Peucedanum hassei, commonly known as the Persian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Peucedanum hassei is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
